titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the William Gilman Thompson Autograph Collection
titlestmt.author: compiled by Janet Elaine Gertz

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday March 27, 2019 at 07:26

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: Collection of autograph letters and photographs accumulated by Thompson, a physician.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: William Gilman Thompson Autograph Collection (MS 484). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of the William G. Thompson estate, 1939.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Physician; Ph.B., Yale, 1877; received his M.D. degree from Columbia in 1881; in 1885 won the Joseph Mather Smith prize for an essay on the valves of the heart; in 1887 became visiting physician of the New York Hospital until 1894, and of the Presbyterian Hospital until 1912; in 1887 became professor of physiology at the University of the City of New York, remaining until 1898; 1898-1916, professor of medicine at Cornell University Medical College.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Collection of autograph letters and photographs accumulated by Thompson, a physician.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown, though much of the material in this collection is likely in the public domain. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.
